definition: warrant officer/petty officer/noncommissioned officer (NCO)/Japanese military officer
member of the senior ministerial class (old)/scholar (old)/bachelor/honorific/soldier/noncommissioned officer/specialist worker

sentences.english: You can hear the sergeant bellowing at the rookies.
sentences.chinese: 你可以聽到士官長對着菜鳥們大吼。

sentences.english: They can also be invaluable in creating a well versed cadre of NCOs and Officers.
sentences.chinese: 這樣打造出精通熟練的士官和軍官幹部是非常寶貴的。

sentences.english: Two in a room, the spot to see Shalewen security officers.
sentences.chinese: 兩人共處一室，當場讓安全士官看傻了眼。

sentences.english: The quartermaster rang up the order on the engine room telegraph.
sentences.chinese: 航信士官通過機艙令鍾傳達了命令。

sentences.english: The captain harried the quarter master for recognition manuals .
sentences.chinese: 艇長催促航信士官給他識別手冊。

sentences.english: Sergeant Howard was reduced to the ranks for disregard of orders.
sentences.chinese: 霍華德士官因爲違抗命令而被降爲小兵。

sentences.english: Lieutenants, even corporals and privates, are trained to be entrepreneurial in combat.
sentences.chinese: 尉官，甚至士官和列兵都受到訓練做一個戰鬥企業家。

sentences.english: We were sent to Inza, where we became sergeants.
sentences.chinese: 我們被派往Inza，在那裏我成了士官。

sentences.english: Prince Bagration asked of the artilleryman standing at the ammunition boxes.
sentences.chinese: 巴格拉季翁公爵問一個站在炮彈箱旁邊的炮兵士官。

sentences.english: Croft and a sergeant from the pioneer and demolition platoon stepped up.
sentences.chinese: 克洛夫特和工兵爆破排的一個士官走了出來。

sentences.english: Every soldier and officer is very important for the task.
sentences.chinese: 每一個士兵和士官對這項任務都非常重要。

sentences.english: Naval cadets in President John F. Kennedy's Inauguration Parade. Washington, Dc', US. 1961
sentences.chinese: 海軍士官生方陣在肯尼迪總統就職典禮的閱兵儀式上。

sentences.english: I am aware of my role as a Noncommissioned Officer.
sentences.chinese: 我注意到了作爲一位士官的任務。

sentences.english: West Point cadets listened Tuesday evening as President Barack Obama, speaking in West Point, N. Y.
sentences.chinese: 西點軍校的士官生在聽奧巴馬總統的演講，紐約。

sentences.english: The award for PO Bailey came as a welcome morale boost for the crew.
sentences.chinese: 對士官柏利的嘉獎提升了潛艇官兵的士氣而受到歡迎。
最重要的是，士官長，我們還活着。

definition: lowest-ranked noncommissioned officer (e.g. corporal in the army or petty officer, third class in the navy)
military officer/ranked officer in Chinese army, divided into 大校, 上校, 中校, 少校
